author: shoddyguard
body:
Running on Mac OS 11.2.3 I cannot use `Push-Location` without error

## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
Push-Location -Path /etc -Passthru

```

## Expected behavior

PowerShell changes locations to that path without error

## Actual behavior

PowerShell changes location but with an error:

```powershell
PS /Users> Push-Location -Path /etc -PassThru   

New-PSSession: /Users/steve.brown/.local/share/powershell/Modules/WindowsCompatibility/1.0.0/WindowsCompatibility.psm1:232:20
Line |
 232 |          $session = New-PSSession @newPSSessionParameters | Select-Obj …
     |                     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | This parameter set requires WSMan, and no supported WSMan client library was found. WSMan is either not installed or unavailable for this system.

PropertyNotFoundException: /Users/steve.brown/.local/share/powershell/Modules/WindowsCompatibility/1.0.0/WindowsCompatibility.psm1:233:13
Line |
 233 |          if ($session.ComputerName -eq "localhost")
     |              ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | The property 'ComputerName' cannot be found on this object. Verify that the property exists.

PropertyNotFoundException: /Users/steve.brown/.local/share/powershell/Modules/WindowsCompatibility/1.0.0/WindowsCompatibility.psm1:102:9
Line |
 102 |      if ($session.ComputerName -eq "localhost")
     |          ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
     | The property 'ComputerName' cannot be found on this object. Verify that the property exists.


Path
----
/etc

```

## Environment data

```powershell
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.2
OS                             Darwin 20.3.0 Darwin Kernel Version 20.3.0: Thu Jan 21 00:07:06 PST 2021; root:xnu-7195.81.3~1/RELEASE_X86_64
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0

```

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body: On macOS, there shouldn't be a Windows-only `WindowsCompatibility ` module in `~/.local/share/powershell/Modules`, so the question is: how did it get there on your machine?

comments.author: shoddyguard
comments.body: Interesting, I have no idea, but a uninstall and reinstall of PoSh seems to have fixed the issue. :)

title: Push-Location throws an error even when successfully changing location
